availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Mary A. Walder Tompkins in June 1851. Father of Bettie W. Tompkins, Anna Tompkins, and Mary A. Tompkins. Sheriff of Mercer County, Kentucky, in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 713
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 48B
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, County Marriages, Film #000191860, p. 336.
Find A Grave, George W. Tompkins (1809-1872)," Memorial #21004869, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21004869 (accessed May 16, 2017).
